rComments: By far the worst instructor I have ever had over the past 3 years. Super lazy professor, she does not proof read notes, copies from textbook, skips classes on Fridays for no reason (literally no reason). Her thesis is just a story, makes it hard to feel like you are learning from someone more knowledgeable.

Please do not take her class. Lecture slides are uploaded after class, and they are just copied from the textbook. She makes sure not to disclose information in class so you have to listen to never ending useless stories and parse through for useful information. She uses words without defining them so even when you are trying to listen it is hard

Took this class at UBC Okanagan. Very well planned schedule. Very heavy on the text and ethnography. Did the summer intensive, so we were required to do about 3 or 4 chapters per week. If you can keep up with the reading and engage in the lectures, you will be play. Only 2 papers, a midterm, and the final.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: material is interesting, some of the articles touch on sensitive issues that bothered me and I did not like that she had chosen them (it was more religous than a health article). Her style of marking resembles that on an English prof. (not the best one; basically if she agrees with you you'll get a good mark). Wouldn't really recommand the course.

Loved this class, easy marker as long as u have something to back up your argument. I think she's more of a TA than an actual prof, so extremely approachable and helpful. for the exam, read every single article at least twice!!!
